Colour palette packages are a nice way to distribute colour palettes while getting access to all the features of **palettes** for free. Below is a listing of colour palette packages made with palettes (please [let me know]() if you have a package youâ€™d like to see added to the list).

See the vignette on creating a colour palette package to learn how to develop your own colour palette package; `vignette("creating-packages")`.

```{r, echo=FALSE}
library(palettes)
library(gt)
library(fontawesome)

palettes:::made_with_palettes |>
  gt(id = "one") |>
  cols_label(
    package = md("**Package**"),
    title = md("**Description**"),
    authors = md("**Author**")
  ) |>
  fmt_url(
    columns = gh_url,
    label = fontawesome::fa("github"),
    color = "#0d6efd",
    show_underline = FALSE
  ) |>
  fmt_url(
    columns = cran_url,
    label = fontawesome::fa("r-project"),
    color = "#0d6efd",
    show_underline = FALSE
  ) |>
  sub_missing() |>
  cols_merge(
    columns = c(package, gh_url, cran_url),
    pattern = "{2} \u2002 {3} \u2002 {1}"
  ) |>
  cols_width(
    package ~ pct(25),
    title ~ pct(40),
    authors ~ pct(35)
  ) |>
  tab_options(
    table.width = pct(100),
    table.font.size = "100%"
  ) |>
  opt_css(
    css = "
    #one svg {
      height: 1.25rem !important;
      width: 1.25rem !important;
    }
    "
  )
```
